title: Bd officer
author: Bd officer
content: I promised in a post on this forum a few months ago. I had a plan to give half of my bitcoin investment to my wife after marriage. I got married a few days ago. First I gave my wife all the ideas about Bitcoin. I was surprised to hear my wife, as soon as I told my wife about Bitcoin, she said that she had heard the name of Bitcoin before. I thought it would be very difficult to convince girls. But my wife was able to understand about Bitcoin very easily. I gave him half of the investment as per my word. He is very happy to get Bitcoin. My wife plans to hold bitcoin for a long time. Now you can say it is better to give girls gold jewelery than bitcoins. I have given gold ornaments to my wife as per her wish. Have any of you managed to teach your wife Bitcoin? Have any of you gifted bitcoin to a wife like me?

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Unfortunately, I have never something like that. First, I don't have a wife and I am 90% sure I may not have one in the near future. Second, I don't have that much Bitcoin worth gifting to anyone I love. Now, I do appreciate what you have just done and I am sure that your wife is a happy wife as she now realized that you think she is valuable enough to be worthy of your trust...and of course, love. I am wishing both of you 100 years of happiness and abundance - you deserve each other and may your family increase by a hundredfold.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: When you and your partner are both on the same boat nothing can stand in your way, every wins and falls will count and you guys will keep getting better at everything, I wish you guys happiness in your marriage, and this is the way it's suppose to be, it's not good when husband is into something good for the financial future and the wife isn't on it, I personally don't like this idea unless it's gambling-related, but when it comes to investment both partners should be in the same boat. If you believe in something do not go on the journey alone if you are married, some people suffered after they lose their partners because of this mistake, imagine leaving your hardware wallet behind for your wife or husband and they can't operate it, even if they have to find someone to do it for them, they can easily get ripped off or scam. This is also why it's wise to choose your partner wisely, make sure they are smart and always willing to learn something new, if you are the type that always feels like no knowledge is too much you will always be a step ahead of people who don't always want to learn something new.

You did a great thing by giving her gold as she requested because you can't just give her bitcoin to hold for a long time some wives may be feeling something or sell it without you knowing because they don't prefer it. As for me, it wasn't a bad thing to gift a wife bitcoin as a surprise, but I would rather do something else, get her something physically not all our women will like holding bitcoin if even they have heard the name before.It seems really ideal to gift a wife bitcoin, but in this case, if it were me, I would use the money to get her into a business because it is the greatest thing i can do. I didn't think you would actually be able to fulfill your promise when I first saw your post a few months ago about giving your wife half of your investment, but you went on to do the right on it.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Congratulations on your marriage. I wish you a happy life. I donâ€™t have a wife, so I donâ€™t know the nature of sharing between married people, but since you need to trust her, it is probably best for you both to manage a multi-signature address. Each of you has a key and the third key is in a safe place. This will reduce any risks associated with her losing her Bitcoin. It is best to leave a small amount for your children, assuming that it will be $50,000 to $200,000, which is sufficient to cover university expenses.

comments.body: Quote from: Bd officer on October 17, 2023, 08:18:29 AM~I thought it would be very difficult to convince girls. But my wife was able to understand about Bitcoin very easily. I gave him half of the investment as per my word. Maybe most women, but you're lucky to have a special girl who also likes and understands Bitcoin at the same time. Bitcoin is not a typical investment, so it's not surprising that some may not be interested in it. I even saw a show once where they conducted a social experiment, interviewing a random girls and asking them to choose between 1 bitcoin and $100. Most of them chose $100 because they didn't know what Bitcoin is and its value; they went for instant money.Anyway, congratulations on your marriage. May you both live long and prosper, just like your Bitcoin holdings. It's nice that you both have your holdings, providing additional security for your future. Good luck with holding and your marriage.
